intro: Artanthe trichoneura, commonly known as the silverleaf artanthe, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery coating of hair. Its small, clustered flowers are typically yellow or orange, appearing in late spring to early summer. Artanthe trichoneura is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its leaves to survive in dry conditions.
